intro: Pholidota yunpeensis, commonly known as the Yunpeen pholidota, is a rare species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological features. The plant is characterized by its unique leaf structure, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically clustered in cyathia, a feature common in the Euphorbiaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pholidota yunpeensis is considered a species of conservation concern.
